question:
Kochi is set to host the 22nd India International Sea Food Show. In this context, consider the following statements:
  1. This is the first time this southern port is hosting the show.
  2. Quantity-wise, frozen fish is the most exported seafood product from India.
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Statement 1 is incorrect: Kochi is set to host the show after 12 years in February 2020. The first show was held in 1973 in Mumbai. The 2018 edition was in Goa. Kochi is a major port in the Arabian Sea and is referred to as the ‘Queen of Arabian Sea’. Statement 2 is correct: India’s seafood industry’s exports are worth over 6.7 billion USD. It is expected to touch 15 million USD in the next 5 years. The largest portion of the export is represented by frozen fish in terms of volume. Frozen shrimp also comprises a large part of the exports. The show will showcase the technological advances in the field.
